ward-01.description: Heavy commercial and private vehicle congestion in central business district during peak hours.
Ongoing metro and commercial building construction projects generating particulate matter.
Limited industrial activity, primarily from nearby commercial establishments.
Occasional waste burning in surrounding residential areas.
Residential cooking and heating fuel consumption in adjoining areas.

ward-02.description: Dense traffic due to major commercial hub and transit connections.
Multiple redevelopment projects and road widening activities.
Small-scale manufacturing units in mixed-use zones.
Open burning of garbage in unauthorized dump sites.
Traditional cooking methods in older residential pockets.

ward-03.description: Congested narrow lanes with heavy goods vehicles and autos.
Heritage area renovations and infrastructure improvements.
Traditional manufacturing, printing, and small foundries.
High waste generation with inadequate disposal systems.
Dense population with mixed fuel usage patterns.

ward-04.description: Major wholesale market generating heavy truck traffic.
Road repairs and building renovations in commercial areas.
Market waste and packaging material burning.
Residential areas using LPG and biomass fuels.

ward-05.description: Metro connectivity has reduced private vehicle usage significantly.
Minimal industrial presence in this residential zone.
Well-managed waste disposal with occasional violations.
Modern apartments predominantly using clean fuels.

ward-06.description: Growing residential area with increasing vehicle ownership.
Rapid urbanization with multiple construction sites.
Nearby industrial areas contributing to ambient pollution.
Construction debris and household waste burning.
Mixed housing with varying fuel preferences.

ward-07.description: Major road intersections causing traffic congestion.
Commercial complex expansions and road improvements.
Controlled waste management with some violations.
Predominantly LPG usage in residential areas.

ward-08.description: Busy commercial market generating significant traffic.
Urban residential with clean fuel adoption.

ward-09.description: Residential area with moderate traffic levels.
Large-scale housing projects in development phase.
Industrial corridor influence from neighboring areas.
Construction waste and green waste burning.
Modern residential developments with gas connections.

ward-10.description: Inadequate waste collection in some areas.
Mixed fuel usage with increasing LPG adoption.

ward-11.description: Commercial hub with organized traffic management.
Minimal construction activity in established area.
High-income area with clean fuel usage.

ward-12.description: Industrial vehicle traffic and goods movement.
Major industrial zone with manufacturing units, power generation, and chemical processing.
Worker settlements with mixed fuel sources.
